info.title: tylercrady.com
info.summary:
I set out to build my personal website with a few directives in mind: learn a css pre-processor (I chose LESS), create the whole thing without a database (flat file), and make it extremely easy to add an image gallery to the site.

By learning some php functions pertaining to scanning directories and reading xml files, having a new gallery fully integrated into my site is as easy as dragging and dropping a folder. Setting up classes, functions, and directory trees in a way that is essentially replicating what would be database tables and queries has been...interesting. Without a database I setup a gallery and portfolio template that are automatically integrated into the menu bar and navigation widgets, as well as login functionality.

While building the site flat file was a fun excercise, there are components of the site that I will be rebuilding using a database. Using a flat file system for many of these functions, and other functionality to come, just doesn't seem practical to me and may get messy as content increases.
